speaker: FORD
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: FORD
text_entry: SCENE I. Athens. The palace of THESEUS.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Enter THESEUS, HIPPOLYTA, PHILOSTRATE, and Attendants

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Now, fair Hippolyta, our nuptial hour

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Draws on apace; four happy days bring in

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Another moon: but, O, methinks, how slow

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: This old moon wanes! she lingers my desires,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Like to a step-dame or a dowager

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Long withering out a young man revenue.

speaker: HIPPOLYTA
text_entry: Four days will quickly steep themselves in night;

speaker: HIPPOLYTA
text_entry: Four nights will quickly dream away the time;

speaker: HIPPOLYTA
text_entry: And then the moon, like to a silver bow

speaker: HIPPOLYTA
text_entry: New-bent in heaven, shall behold the night

speaker: HIPPOLYTA
text_entry: Of our solemnities.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Go, Philostrate,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Stir up the Athenian youth to merriments;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Awake the pert and nimble spirit of mirth;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Turn melancholy forth to funerals;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: The pale companion is not for our pomp.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Exit PHILOSTRATE

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Hippolyta, I woo'd thee with my sword,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: And won thy love, doing thee injuries;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: But I will wed thee in another key,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: With pomp, with triumph and with revelling.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Enter EGEUS, HERMIA, LYSANDER, and DEMETRIUS

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Happy be Theseus, our renowned duke!

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Thanks, good Egeus: what's the news with thee?

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Full of vexation come I, with complaint

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Against my child, my daughter Hermia.

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Stand forth, Demetrius. My noble lord,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: This man hath my consent to marry her.

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Stand forth, Lysander: and my gracious duke,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: This man hath bewitch'd the bosom of my child;

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Thou, thou, Lysander, thou hast given her rhymes,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: And interchanged love-tokens with my child:

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Thou hast by moonlight at her window sung,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: With feigning voice verses of feigning love,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: And stolen the impression of her fantasy

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: With bracelets of thy hair, rings, gawds, conceits,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Knacks, trifles, nosegays, sweetmeats, messengers

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Of strong prevailment in unharden'd youth:

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: With cunning hast thou filch'd my daughter's heart,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Turn'd her obedience, which is due to me,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: To stubborn harshness: and, my gracious duke,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Be it so she; will not here before your grace

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Consent to marry with Demetrius,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: I beg the ancient privilege of Athens,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: As she is mine, I may dispose of her:

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Which shall be either to this gentleman

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Or to her death, according to our law

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Immediately provided in that case.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: What say you, Hermia? be advised fair maid:

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: To you your father should be as a god;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: One that composed your beauties, yea, and one

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: To whom you are but as a form in wax

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: By him imprinted and within his power

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: To leave the figure or disfigure it.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Demetrius is a worthy gentleman.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: So is Lysander.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: In himself he is;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: But in this kind, wanting your father's voice,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: The other must be held the worthier.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: I would my father look'd but with my eyes.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Rather your eyes must with his judgment look.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: I do entreat your grace to pardon me.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: I know not by what power I am made bold,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Nor how it may concern my modesty,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: In such a presence here to plead my thoughts;

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: But I beseech your grace that I may know

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: The worst that may befall me in this case,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: If I refuse to wed Demetrius.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Either to die the death or to abjure

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: For ever the society of men.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Therefore, fair Hermia, question your desires;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Know of your youth, examine well your blood,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Whether, if you yield not to your father's choice,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: You can endure the livery of a nun,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: For aye to be in shady cloister mew'd,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: To live a barren sister all your life,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Chanting faint hymns to the cold fruitless moon.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Thrice-blessed they that master so their blood,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: To undergo such maiden pilgrimage;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: But earthlier happy is the rose distill'd,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Than that which withering on the virgin thorn

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Grows, lives and dies in single blessedness.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: So will I grow, so live, so die, my lord,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Ere I will my virgin patent up

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Unto his lordship, whose unwished yoke

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: My soul consents not to give sovereignty.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Take time to pause; and, by the nest new moon--

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: The sealing-day betwixt my love and me,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: For everlasting bond of fellowship--

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Upon that day either prepare to die

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: For disobedience to your father's will,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Or else to wed Demetrius, as he would;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Or on Diana's altar to protest

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: For aye austerity and single life.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Relent, sweet Hermia: and, Lysander, yield

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Thy crazed title to my certain right.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: You have her father's love, Demetrius;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Let me have Hermia's: do you marry him.

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Scornful Lysander! true, he hath my love,

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: And what is mine my love shall render him.

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: And she is mine, and all my right of her

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: I do estate unto Demetrius.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: I am, my lord, as well derived as he,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: As well possess'd; my love is more than his;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: My fortunes every way as fairly rank'd,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: If not with vantage, as Demetrius';

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And, which is more than all these boasts can be,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: I am beloved of beauteous Hermia:

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Why should not I then prosecute my right?

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Demetrius, I'll avouch it to his head,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Made love to Nedar's daughter, Helena,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And won her soul; and she, sweet lady, dotes,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Devoutly dotes, dotes in idolatry,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Upon this spotted and inconstant man.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: I must confess that I have heard so much,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: And with Demetrius thought to have spoke thereof;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: But, being over-full of self-affairs,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: My mind did lose it. But, Demetrius, come;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: And come, Egeus; you shall go with me,

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: I have some private schooling for you both.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: For you, fair Hermia, look you arm yourself

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: To fit your fancies to your father's will;

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Or else the law of Athens yields you up--

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Which by no means we may extenuate--

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: To death, or to a vow of single life.

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Come, my Hippolyta: what cheer, my love?

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Demetrius and Egeus, go along:

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: I must employ you in some business

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Against our nuptial and confer with you

speaker: THESEUS
text_entry: Of something nearly that concerns yourselves.

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: With duty and desire we follow you.

speaker: EGEUS
text_entry: Exeunt all but LYSANDER and HERMIA

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: How now, my love! why is your cheek so pale?

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: How chance the roses there do fade so fast?

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Belike for want of rain, which I could well

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Beteem them from the tempest of my eyes.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Ay me! for aught that I could ever read,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Could ever hear by tale or history,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: The course of true love never did run smooth;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: But, either it was different in blood,--

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: O cross! too high to be enthrall'd to low.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Or else misgraffed in respect of years,--

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: O spite! too old to be engaged to young.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Or else it stood upon the choice of friends,--

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: O hell! to choose love by another's eyes.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Or, if there were a sympathy in choice,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: War, death, or sickness did lay siege to it,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Making it momentany as a sound,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Swift as a shadow, short as any dream;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Brief as the lightning in the collied night,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: That, in a spleen, unfolds both heaven and earth,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And ere a man hath power to say 'Behold!'

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: The jaws of darkness do devour it up:

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: So quick bright things come to confusion.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: If then true lovers have been ever cross'd,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: It stands as an edict in destiny:

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Then let us teach our trial patience,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Because it is a customary cross,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: As due to love as thoughts and dreams and sighs,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Wishes and tears, poor fancy's followers.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: A good persuasion: therefore, hear me, Hermia.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: I have a widow aunt, a dowager

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Of great revenue, and she hath no child:

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: From Athens is her house remote seven leagues;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And she respects me as her only son.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: There, gentle Hermia, may I marry thee;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And to that place the sharp Athenian law

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Cannot pursue us. If thou lovest me then,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Steal forth thy father's house to-morrow night;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And in the wood, a league without the town,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Where I did meet thee once with Helena,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: To do observance to a morn of May,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: There will I stay for thee.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: My good Lysander!

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: I swear to thee, by Cupid's strongest bow,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: By his best arrow with the golden head,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: By the simplicity of Venus' doves,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: By that which knitteth souls and prospers loves,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: And by that fire which burn'd the Carthage queen,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: When the false Troyan under sail was seen,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: By all the vows that ever men have broke,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: In number more than ever women spoke,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: In that same place thou hast appointed me,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: To-morrow truly will I meet with thee.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Keep promise, love. Look, here comes Helena.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Enter HELENA

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: God speed fair Helena! whither away?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Call you me fair? that fair again unsay.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Demetrius loves your fair: O happy fair!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Your eyes are lode-stars; and your tongue's sweet air

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: More tuneable than lark to shepherd's ear,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: When wheat is green, when hawthorn buds appear.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Sickness is catching: O, were favour so,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Yours would I catch, fair Hermia, ere I go;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: My ear should catch your voice, my eye your eye,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: My tongue should catch your tongue's sweet melody.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Were the world mine, Demetrius being bated,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The rest I'd give to be to you translated.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: O, teach me how you look, and with what art

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: You sway the motion of Demetrius' heart.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: I frown upon him, yet he loves me still.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: O that your frowns would teach my smiles such skill!

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: I give him curses, yet he gives me love.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: O that my prayers could such affection move!

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: The more I hate, the more he follows me.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The more I love, the more he hateth me.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: His folly, Helena, is no fault of mine.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: None, but your beauty: would that fault were mine!

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Take comfort: he no more shall see my face;

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Lysander and myself will fly this place.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Before the time I did Lysander see,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Seem'd Athens as a paradise to me:

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: O, then, what graces in my love do dwell,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: That he hath turn'd a heaven unto a hell!

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Helen, to you our minds we will unfold:

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: To-morrow night, when Phoebe doth behold

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Her silver visage in the watery glass,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Decking with liquid pearl the bladed grass,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: A time that lovers' flights doth still conceal,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Through Athens' gates have we devised to steal.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: And in the wood, where often you and I

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Upon faint primrose-beds were wont to lie,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Emptying our bosoms of their counsel sweet,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: There my Lysander and myself shall meet;

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: And thence from Athens turn away our eyes,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: To seek new friends and stranger companies.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Farewell, sweet playfellow: pray thou for us;

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: And good luck grant thee thy Demetrius!

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Keep word, Lysander: we must starve our sight

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: From lovers' food till morrow deep midnight.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: I will, my Hermia.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Exit HERMIA

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Helena, adieu:

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: As you on him, Demetrius dote on you!

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: How happy some o'er other some can be!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Through Athens I am thought as fair as she.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But what of that? Demetrius thinks not so;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: He will not know what all but he do know:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And as he errs, doting on Hermia's eyes,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: So I, admiring of his qualities:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Things base and vile, folding no quantity,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Love can transpose to form and dignity:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And therefore is wing'd Cupid painted blind:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Nor hath Love's mind of any judgement taste;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Wings and no eyes figure unheedy haste:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And therefore is Love said to be a child,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Because in choice he is so oft beguiled.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: As waggish boys in game themselves forswear,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: So the boy Love is perjured every where:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: For ere Demetrius look'd on Hermia's eyne,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: He hail'd down oaths that he was only mine;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And when this hail some heat from Hermia felt,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: So he dissolved, and showers of oaths did melt.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I will go tell him of fair Hermia's flight:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Then to the wood will he to-morrow night

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Pursue her; and for this intelligence

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: If I have thanks, it is a dear expense:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But herein mean I to enrich my pain,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: To have his sight thither and back again.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Exit
